Description: Body fragment of North Ionian Wild Goat Style pottery oinochoe or amphora; interior reserved; exterior, cream slip: between bands, with probable added colour, frieze of goats grazing to right; forepart of goat on left, rear of one to right; added red on belly and haunch; variety of filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.657)
CVA Edinburgh / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum National Museums of Scotland Edinburgh (p. 4 and pl. 3, 15)
